questions.prompt: Given its primary title, one might expect a 2018 nonfiction book by Stephen Fried to be about a certain Canadian trio, or perhaps about a certain radio personality, but it is in fact about what physician and signer of the Declaration of Independence?
What is the only country on the South American continent whose capital city is named after a British monarch?
Though it is sometimes confused with rotini—including by some pasta mass producers—rotelle (also known in Italy as ruote) is the name for a type of pasta whose shape most typically resembles what?
In 1935, St. Petersburg's Mariinski Ballet was renamed in honor of what revolutionary leader? The name was changed back in 1992, after the collapse of the Soviet Union.

The short-lived and unmemorable CBS drama series Three for the Road, which starred Alex Rocco, Vincent Van Patten, and Leif Garrett as a dad and two sons traveling the USA via RV, was replaced in December 1975 in its time slot by what other program? This other program, which had been shifted from a different time that day, has remained in this slot ever since.
There are two consecutive elements on the periodic table that are named after the city and state, respectively, where these particular elements were first discovered. What is the name of that city?
